DIRECTOR: Lenny Abrahamson


COVER/MENU:
-----------



CAST:
---------
Tom Murphy, Mark O'Halloran, Gary Egan, Deirdre Molloy, Mary Murray, Michael McElhatton


PLOT:
---------
Friends since they were small boys, Adam and Paul - and we never learn which is which - have withered into two hapless, desperate Dublin junkies, tied together by
habit and necessity. A stylized, downbeat comedy, the film follows the pair through a single day, which, like every other, is entirely devoted to the business of scrounging and robbing money for drugs.The difference today is that Adam and Paul - already near rock bottom - have finally run out of luck, credit and friends.
Stylistically, 'Adam & Paul' is a cold, contemporary take on classic, physical comedy. Thematically, it is a minimal fairytale about two baffled, vulnerable children in the grip of forces too powerful for them to handle; vulnerable, lost, sometimes pathetically optimistic, but always profoundly damaged. 'Adam & Paul' is not a film without hope; it is a tender, unsentimental and very funny testament to the persistence of the human spirit in even the most damaged and marginal of people.
